sentence.Network_en: Give the dog the bone do not tantalize him.

sentence.Network_cn: 把那块骨头给那条狗吧--别让它乾着急了.

诱人的tantalizing smell诱人的气味21. I was unaware of the critical

entry.tran: 使(某人)想要却得不到(某物);逗引;挑逗;撩拨
entry.def: If someone or something tantalizes you, they make you feel hopeful and excited about getting what you want, usually before disappointing you by not letting you have what they appeared to offer.

example.ex: The boy would come into the room and tantalize the dog with his feed.
example.tran: 那个男孩会到房间里拿狗食逗弄狗。

example.ex: ...the dreams of democracy that have so tantalized them.
example.tran: 他们可望而不可即的民主梦想

means.word_mean: 1. harass with persistent criticism or carping;

sentences.sentence: "Don't ride me so hard over my failure"
"His fellow workers razzed him when he wore a jacket and tie"

auth_sentence.content: His life as self-styled genius and unrepentant poseur continues to tantalize.
